displayed_text: Patient: I’m not that bad but there is a lot of inconsistency though. Doctor: Right but that’s your body doesn’t do well with inconsistency. It wants to know what’s coming. So if you know for example, you’re just having a hard time sleeping, then just take your Norco at night so that way you can get a good night’s rest. Patient: Okay. Doctor: If you know listen at night I’m not bothered I sleep like a rock, then take it when you first get up so that you can function. Patient: Sure. Doctor: Or you get up and it’s tolerable but now it’s the early afternoon, you still have more stuff to do, you’ve got family, you’ve got friends, there’s a barbeque, so take some, just a small amount… Patient: Sure. Doctor: To take the edge off. Patient: Sure. Doctor: So that you can actually enjoy your life. Patient: Sure. Quality has been there. It hasn’t been compromised yet. Doctor: Yeah. Patient: And I understand where you’re

Patient: No. You’ve got it all. Doctor: So I’m going to put Bell’s palsy on here. You said it’s lopsided? Patient: Um hum. Doctor: And you’ve had, not had any issues with depression in the past or anxiety? Patient: No. Doctor: Any acid reflux? Patient: Uh-uh. Doctor: Ever have a seizure? Patient: No. Doctor: Stroke? Patient: Nope. Doctor: Sleep apnea?
